title: AI-powered visual search comes to the iPhone
content:
Visual search is coming to the iPhone, powered by Apple Intelligence, Apple’s suite of AI capabilities. The Camera Control, the new button on the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, can launch what Apple calls “visual intelligence” — basically a reverse image search combined with some text recognition. If you use visual intelligence to search for […]

title: Apple adds a dedicated camera button on iPhone 16
content:
Pressing the button for the first time will open the camera app. You press it to take a photo and press and hold to start a video recording.

title: Apple announces its new A18 iPhone chip
content:
To nobody’s surprise, Apple today debuted its A18 system-on-a-chip, the successor to the A17 Pro chip it announced at its last iPhone event. If you recall, at that time, Apple only announced an A17 Pro, which was featured in the iPhone Pro and Pro Max models, leaving some to speculate that a regular A17 chip […]

title: Apple updates AirPods Max headphones with a USB-C port and new colors
content:
Apple released a new version of its premium over-the-ear headphones, AirPods Max, on Monday during its 2024 Apple Event. The revamp replaces the AirPods Max’s lightning port with a USB-C port, and comes in five new colors: midnight, blue, purple, orange, and starlight. The updated version of Apple’s AirPods Max are still $549, and can […]

content:

title: Apple is adding a sleep apnea detection feature to the Apple Watch Series 10, 9 and Ultra 2
content:
At its Glowtime event on Monday, Apple announced that it’s adding a new Apple Watch feature that can alert users to sleep apnea, a health condition that causes you to stop breathing when you’re asleep. Apple says it expects to receive FDA clearance for the feature “very soon.” The feature will available on the new […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: U.S., China and other nations convene in Seoul for summit on AI use in military
content:
More than 90 nations, including the U.S. and China, will convene at a two-day summit in Seoul starting Monday to attempt to establish a blueprint for the use of AI in the military. As Reuters reports, participants hope to establish minimum guardrails and suggest principles for “responsible” AI deployment aligned with NATO principles. The summit […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: Alpha Partners raises $153M third fund for pro-rata investments
content:
Steve Brotman started Alpha Partners in 2014 with a novel idea at the time: investing alongside early-stage VCs to help preserve their ownership in promising companies as they transition to later funding rounds. Alpha’s first fund was a mere $10 million. But as startups started staying private for longer, the VC industry invented various mechanisms […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: TechCrunch Minute: Another blow to the Internet Archive’s lending library
content:
The Internet Archive’s online lending library recently suffered a big defeat in court. The organization is best known for operating the Wayback Machine, which stores old versions of web pages, a task that’s felt increasingly important as more of the web disappears. But the Archive also operated a digital lending library, called the Open Library, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: Progress acquires file management platform ShareFile for $875M
content:
Automation and IT monitoring company Progress on Monday announced that it intends to acquire file management platform ShareFile for $875 million in cash and credit. Progress CEO Yogesh Gupta said that the deal, which is expected to close by November 30, will bolster Progress’ portfolio with tools to help businesses more efficiently share — and […]

title: YC alum Odigos aims to help enterprises find errors and stamp out latency in their systems
content:
Companies’ data architecture today looks nothing like it did 20 years ago, but monitoring and tracing tools haven’t followed suit, making it difficult for engineering teams to identify the root cause of errors and latency issues.  Israeli developer Eden Federman (pictured above, right) thinks the solution is distributed tracing, a more advanced observability method, but […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.
